newsitem.title: UK: NWE high sulphur fuel prices soften, gloom ahead.
newsitem.headline: NWE high sulphur fuel prices soften, gloom ahead.

text.p: NWE high sulphur fuel oil prices softened on Friday with traders gloomily forecasting further falls next week in a bearish market despite a late rally on Brent crude futures.
Utility buyers heard offers of $82 a tonne cif NWE for high sulphur cargoes, down $2 on the day, but no trades were reported and bids were thought to be slipping below Thursday's $80 mark.
"The price is still on the slide," said one buyer, "I wouldn't be surprised if we see numbers beginning with seven soon."
Warm weather leading to over-supply, fluctuating crude prices and the expected influx of Iraqi material were all said to be weighing down the fuel oil sector, traders said.
"It's a very dismal picture ahead for next week," said one trader.
High sulphur barges slipped $2 to $83.50, with trades heard at $86, $82 and then $84 a tonne.
High sulphur cargo prices in the Med also fell, with cargoes chasing homes and Thursday's sale to a Spanish refinery of bunker material setting the marker below its price of $85.50.
Low sulphur fuel oil prices in the north and the Med were supported by poor prompt supply but low U.S. prices for late month availability will cap rises, traders said.
One European refiner was heard to be offering low sulphur fuel oil at $102 fob, above price norms, but no buyers were seen in a thin market.
